description.narrative: The main objective of the JAP is to help design, implement, monitor and evaluate evidence-based and gender-sensitive measures to maintain the productive base and firm structure (formal/informal).

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: a. Number of comprehensive assessments report to identify MSMEs impacted by the pandemic and data base set up. b. 5000 youths (60% women) with enhanced awareness on vocational training and assisted with start-up grants for small businesses related to COVID-19 response including Hygiene and sanitation materials c. Number of online mobile platforms set up for MSMEs for enhanced virtual service provisions/ improvements. d. Number of integrated MSMEs with supply chains with industrial parks for better income. e. Number of “one window” service established by the Government in the regions on SMEs supported. f. Number of updated and need-based assessment reports on potential green jobs. g. Number of small enterprises directly impacted by the pandemic benefited from emergency COVID-19 support to revamp businesses and jobs for the youth (60% women). h. Number of youths (20,000; 60% women) engaged in cash for work through waste management and hygiene improvement interventions. i. Number of youths (60% women) in rural areas engaged on planting of agro-forestry trees in degraded areas through cash for work to enhance environmental conservation.

comment.narrative: a. There is very little data on the impact of the pandemic on MSMEs in order to set up a data base and enable small business to regain their productivity b. Small enterprises mostly of women owned are unable to become self-supportive and incapable due to COVID-19 pandemic c. Lack of functioning online mobile platform for MSMEs for an enhanced virtual service provisions/ improvement. d. Lack of integration of MSMEs with supply chains for industrial parks e. Lack of functional capacity of a “one window” service established by the Government in the regions on SMEs. f. Lack of updated and need-based assessment conducted, and potential green jobs documented. g. Lack of resources to provide support to pandemic impacted small enterprises to retain jobs. h. Insufficient resources to ensure proper waste management, good hygiene and jobs that benefit 20,000 youth (60% women) i. Lack of income for rural communities impacted by the pandemic

α. At least 1 socio-economic impact report on the pandemic is accessible and used to set up a data base on MSMEs. b. 5000 youths (60% women) are supported through vocational training and with business startup capital c. one functional online mobile platform for MSMEs is established /installed for enhanced virtual service provisions/ improvements. d. three or more MSMEs are integrated with supply chains through industrial parks. e. At least one “one window” services established by the Government in the regions on SMEs are reinforced through capacity building process. f. At least one updated and need-based assessment report on potential green jobs accessible. g. 500 small enterprises directly impacted by the pandemic are supported and led to 50,000 jobs retained. h. 20,000 youths (60% women) have received cash through cash for work on waste management and hygiene improvements i. 5000 youths (60% women) have engaged on planting of agro–forestry trees in degraded areas through cash for work
